body.p: Cardiac tamponade would most directly be caused by __________.

multiple_choice.choice: an abnormal conduction pathway through the septum

response.feedback: Incorrect. Atherosclerosis in the coronary arteries can lead to a heart attack. This could eventually lead to cardiac tamponade as well, but it is not the most direct mechanism.
Incorrect. Narrowing of the mitral valve (mitral stenosis), could cause problems, but not as cardiac tamponade.
Incorrect. Conduction pathway abnormalities do not lead to cardiac tamponade.
Correct. Cardiac tamponade is most directly caused by inflammation to the pericardium, leading to accumulation of pus or blood in the pericardial space, interfering with heart function.
